data.title: International train route to Poland
data.text:
The long-awaited international route is reborn and will delight EVERYDAY in both directions!

Train connections between Vilnius–Warsaw–Krakow–Vilnius will be made by connecting trains at Mockava railway station (Lithuania).

The number of train tickets for the Vilnius–Warsaw–Krakow–Vilnius route is limited. Therefore, we recommend that you buy your tickets in advance, and there are several ways to do this!

Purchase a general 2nd class ticket for the whole journey (from your departure station in Lithuania to your arrival station in Poland and vice versa) on www.ltglink.lt

Purchase a general 2nd class ticket for the whole journey (from your departure station in Lithuania to your arrival station in Poland and vice versa) on www.intercity.pl

Snacks, food, and drinks can be purchased throughout Lithuania. However, we recommend that you take care of them before you change trains at Mockava railway station (Lithuania), as the Polish partner PKP Intercity only sells food on these sections of the route:

Trakiškės–Warsaw.

Warsaw–Trakiškės.

Passengers travelling on this route must reserve a seat independently on the website www.ltglink.lt, in the mobile application (APPs) and on trains from travel attendants. The reservation fee is €5.

How to buy tickets www.ltglink.lt and mobile application (APPs) for Eurail / Interrail passport holders can be found here.
